title: Can the "ultimate cap" rune push your ultimate past the cdr limit?
body: Or does it just push your ultimate to the cap faster than your other abilities?

replies.body: Yes. Do note however that unlike normal cdr it is multiplicative rather than additive.

Literally you are adding your base in-game cdr first then comes in the 15% which kinda doesn't lower as much as you want it to. It's not like going to be 60% cdr cooldowns but rather 45% first then 15% after the amount is subtracted.

Well, it says 5% cdr reduction and 2% on each ult use so that's 10% max on 5 stacks. 5%+10% = 15% Yup, will push it faster. You can put a Zilean who's 45% cd with 33 second ult into 28 second ult, which is very fast.
